components.docblock:
Used to wrap a label in abbreviation tags if a valid tooltip is provided. We differentiate the abbr style
depending on the type passed in so that the dotted line is shown properly on the metric labels.

childrenComponentProp.docblock: String description of the label

The type of object that the label is being defined for.
Choices: metric, dimension or any(default)

description.text:
The type of object that the label is being defined for.
Choices: metric, dimension or any(default)

Used to wrap a label in abbreviation tags if a valid tooltip is provided. We differentiate the abbr style
depending on the type passed in so that the dotted line is shown properly on the metric labels.

components.docblock:
Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.

childrenComponentProp.name: component
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

description.text: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

childrenComponentProp.name: loader
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

description.text: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

childrenComponentProp.name: loading
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: found
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: error
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

description.text:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.

components.docblock:
Year and Month Picker Component that shows a dropdown where you can select a
specific month in year.

childrenComponentProp.docblock: Year-Month value, needs to be formated like this: YYYY-MM(2019-11)

description.text: Year-Month value, needs to be formated like this: YYYY-MM(2019-11)

childrenComponentProp.name: onClose
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback invoked when the dropdown menu closes. This function is invoked with
formatted string value, year and month arguments.

description.text:
Callback invoked when the dropdown menu closes. This function is invoked with
formatted string value, year and month arguments.

childrenComponentProp.name: onChange
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback invoked when either month or year value changes. This function is invoked with
formatted string value, year and month arguments.

description.text:
Callback invoked when either month or year value changes. This function is invoked with
formatted string value, year and month arguments.

Year and Month Picker Component that shows a dropdown where you can select a
specific month in year.

Component that behaves as a wrapper around `react-select` component in order
to create a unified API between different version of the original component.

description.text: Key used to extract the label from the options object. Defaults to `label`

description.text: Available select options

childrenComponentProp.docblock: Should the value from the select's input field be created when it's missing in the options

childrenComponentProp.name: multi
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Should this component accept multiple values

description.text: Should this component accept multiple values

childrenComponentProp.name: async
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Loads the data from a promise or a callback

description.text: Loads the data from a promise or a callback

have been changed. Meaning the form is in a `dirty` state.

childrenComponentProp.name: onAdd
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback function that transforms and adds a new element. If not defined, initialFieldValue will be used
instead. Callback receives no argument and should return the new object object.

description.text:
Callback function that transforms and adds a new element. If not defined, initialFieldValue will be used
instead. Callback receives no argument and should return the new object object.

childrenComponentProp.name: onDuplicate
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback function that transforms the current element into a duplicated one and adds it. Callback receives
the current object as argument and should return the new object.

description.text:
Callback function that transforms the current element into a duplicated one and adds it. Callback receives
the current object as argument and should return the new object.

metadata.docblock:
Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.

childrenComponentProp.name: component
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

description.text: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

childrenComponentProp.name: loader
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

description.text: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

childrenComponentProp.name: loading
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: found
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: error
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

description.text:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.
